newsitem.title: UK: LPC-Iceland gets 285 mln loan for buyback.
newsitem.headline: LPC-Iceland gets 285 mln loan for buyback.

text.p: LONDON, March 12 (LPC) - BZW is arranging a 285 million stg loan facility supporting frozen food retailer Iceland Group Plc's proposed capital reduction, bankers said.
Iceland announced Wednesday that it intends to cancel 35 per cent of its ordinary shares at a price of 105 pence each. About 118 million stg of the loan will be used to fund the buyback.

The loan facility, which has been fully underwritten by Barclays Bank, will also be used to refinance existing credit lines following the capital reconstruction. An additional tranche will provide working capital. BZW will shortly ask some of Iceland's existing relationship banks to join the deal as sub-underwriters.

If the proposed reconstruction goes to plan, gaining both shareholder and court approval, then the effective date of the capital reduction will be May 8. General syndication of the loan facility would then follow.
